Get User Leagues

Source: R/generics.R, R/mfl_userleagues.R, R/sleeper_userleagues.R
ff_userleagues.Rd

This function returns a tibble with one row for every league a user is in. This requries authentication cookies for MFL usage.

This function retrieves a tibble of all user leagues and requires an authentication cookie to be stored inside the MFL conn object (which were created via username/password args)

This function retrieves a tibble of all user leagues (which were created via username/password args)

ff_userleagues(conn, ...)

# S3 method for mfl_conn
ff_userleagues(conn, season = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for sleeper_conn
ff_userleagues(conn, user_name = NULL, ...)

Arguments

conn

a connection object created by ff_connect()
...

arguments that may be passed to other methods (for method consistency)
season

the MFL platform season to look for
user_name

the username to look up - defaults to user created in conn if available

Value

A tidy dataframe with one row for every league a user is in

Methods (by class)

  • mfl_conn: MFL: With an authentication token, it will return a list of user leagues.

  • sleeper_conn: Sleeper: returns a listing of leagues for a given user_id or user_name
